docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Oct. 8. -- The second day of the Chamber Music in the Library of Congress was made notable by the first appearance in this country of the Pro Arte String Quartet of Brussels, which provided the whole program of the morning concert, and the performance of the work which won the Elizabeth Sprague Coolidge prize for 1926.

headline.main: PRO ARTE QUARTET PLAYS PRIZE WORK; Artists From Brussels Heard in Washington in a Sonata by Albert Huybrecht. THEIR PERFORMANCE A JOY Stringwood Ensemble Gives Afternoon Concert of Russian Music Including Folk Songs.

docs.abstract: Concerts at Library of Cone Chamber Music Festival
